pr_title: [astro] Refactoring eclipse handling by moon and sun

timeline.message:
Adressing issue #8042 and refactoring eclipse handling by moon and sun

Signed-off-by: clinique <gael@lhopital.org>

Correcting SAT error and a bit of org.apache.commons removal.

Signed-off-by: clinique <gael@lhopital.org>

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
public Eclipse(List<EclipseKind> eclipses) {
eclipses.forEach(eclipseKind -> {
entries.put(eclipseKind, new SimpleEntry<>(Calendar.getInstance(), null));
});
}
public Eclipse(EclipseKind... eclipses) {
for(EclipseKind eclipseKind : eclipses) {
entries.put(eclipseKind, new SimpleEntry<>(Calendar.getInstance(), null));
}
}

Using variable arguments would simplify calling this constructor.
timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.body: You need to make sure that the map doesn't hold a null value at that key, otherwise you will get a NPE when calling `getKey()`. The same null check should be done for the other getter methods as well.
timeline.bodyText: You need to make sure that the map doesn't hold a null value at that key, otherwise you will get a NPE when calling getKey(). The same null check should be done for the other getter methods as well.
timeline.bodyHTML: You need to make sure that the map doesn't hold a null value at that key, otherwise you will get a NPE when calling getKey(). The same null check should be done for the other getter methods as well.
timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.body: The return type should be nullable.
timeline.bodyText: The return type should be nullable.
timeline.bodyHTML: The return type should be nullable.
timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.body: You should make sure that you are actually catching a parse exception here, for all you know you might be catching a NPE and you wouldn't be able to tell just by looking at your logging statement.
timeline.bodyText: You should make sure that you are actually catching a parse exception here, for all you know you might be catching a NPE and you wouldn't be able to tell just by looking at your logging statement.
timeline.bodyHTML: You should make sure that you are actually catching a parse exception here, for all you know you might be catching a NPE and you wouldn't be able to tell just by looking at your logging statement.
timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.body: This logic seems to be used in multiple places, can it be refactored into the Eclipse class instead?
timeline.bodyText: This logic seems to be used in multiple places, can it be refactored into the Eclipse class instead?
timeline.bodyHTML: This logic seems to be used in multiple places, can it be refactored into the Eclipse class instead?
timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.body:
To make the null checks more consistent, you should just make the map value nullable here.
```suggestion
    private final Map<EclipseKind, @Nullable Entry<Calendar, @Nullable Double>> entries = new HashMap<>();
```
timeline.bodyHTML:
To make the null checks more consistent, you should just make the map value nullable here.

Suggested change
private final Map<EclipseKind, Entry<Calendar, @Nullable Double>> entries = new HashMap<>();
private final Map<EclipseKind, @Nullable Entry<Calendar, @Nullable Double>> entries = new HashMap<>();
timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
abstract @Nullable public Position getPositionAt(ZonedDateTime date);
public abstract @Nullable Position getPositionAt(ZonedDateTime date);
timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.body: This change causes only the first channel to be checked. Is that intentional?
timeline.bodyText: This change causes only the first channel to be checked. Is that intentional?
timeline.bodyHTML: This change causes only the first channel to be checked. Is that intentional?
timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.body: I'd prefer if you cached `Arrays.asList(getPositionalChannelIds())` in a local variable so that it doesn't create a new array during each iteration of the for loop.
timeline.bodyText: I'd prefer if you cached Arrays.asList(getPositionalChannelIds()) in a local variable so that it doesn't create a new array during each iteration of the for loop.
timeline.bodyHTML: I'd prefer if you cached Arrays.asList(getPositionalChannelIds()) in a local variable so that it doesn't create a new array during each iteration of the for loop.
